Planning and Advisory Committees

    Current Status Critical Needs Long Range Goals
         
1 Strategic Planning: commitment to and understanding of the importance of information resources at the institution is evident at the highest level and integral to the strategic planning process. Interim Executive Director of ICS is on the senior staff of the College; budget autonomy; specific Trustee subcommittee; IT plan is integral part of College strategic plan Excellence in IT provides strategic value for asset management, student services, cost containment (productivity enhancements) and information access (academic division) Constant reassessment of strategic applications of technology
         
2 Advisory committees for academic, administrative, library, information access, and other services are in place to guide and advise the priorities of the information resource areas. Administrative User's Group; Curricular Policy Committee subcommittee for ICS; Science Computing Advisory Committee; Networked Information Services Policy Board - most replaced by Info Resources Council Make Information Resources Council a central forum for planning and communication Unified Information Resources Council becomes integral part of campus culture for determining strategic value and application of technology
         
3 Assessment: client survey and benchmarking process is in place to assess the effectiveness of the information resources areas. Seven years' longitudinal survey data but not definable as "customer satisfaction" information Redesign the current survey process to gather more informative data on client satisfaction; use the new information to refine support services Continually redesign and refine survey tools to gather sound quantitative data for IT Council discussions
         
4 Flexibility: organizations within the institution, especially the information technology organization, are flexible and able to change rapidly in support of changing business needs. A strength of ICS staff, but rate of change continues to increase Review and realign positions within ICS to increase front line services, facilitate communication and collaborative work Annual review of internal ICS reporting structures

Contact: Scott Siddall, Information and Computing Services, scott@siddall.info
Edited: 01-27-97
